Docs.summary: Represents the maximum number of connections to a remote computer. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class corresponds to the [\<add\> Element for connectionManagement (Network Settings)](../Topic/%3Cadd%3E%20Element%20for%20connectionManagement%20\(Network%20Settings\).md) configuration element.
This class is used to specify the maximum number of simultaneous connections to a remote computer.
This class provides programmatic access to information that can be stored in configuration files.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can set this property using an asterisk (*) to set the default number of connections for unspecified computers.
This property identifies one or more remote computers and the <xref:System.Net.Configuration.ConnectionManagementElement.MaxConnection%2A> property specifies how many simultaneous connections are allowed between the local computer and the remote computers.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of connections that can be made to a remote computer.
Docs.value: An integer that specifies the maximum number of connections.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property specifies how many simultaneous connections are allowed between the local computer and the remote computer. The remote computer is specified using the <xref:System.Net.Configuration.ConnectionManagementElement.Address%2A> property.
The MaxConnection property is per <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.ConnectionGroupName%2A?displayProperty=fullName>. If an application is not changing <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.ConnectionGroupName%2A?displayProperty=fullName> from the default, then the MaxConnection property applies to the entire application domain. If only a single application domain is running in your application, then the MaxConnection property setting is application-wide.
